meanings.definition: A person who believes in the unity of God and rejects the doctrine of the Trinity.
meanings.sent1: The unitarian at the church spoke about the oneness of God.
meanings.sent2: My neighbor is a unitarian and does not believe in the Trinity.
meanings.sent3: The unitarian joked that God must have a hard time keeping track of all the different gods people believe in.
meanings.sent4: Her belief as a unitarian was a beacon of light in a world of conflicting doctrines.
meanings.sent5: The unitarian's faith in the unity of God was unwavering.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of Unitarianism.
meanings.sent1: The unitarian teachings focus on the unity of God.
meanings.sent2: She follows a unitarian approach to spirituality.
meanings.sent3: The unitarian principles guided their community towards harmony.
meanings.sent4: His unitarian beliefs colored every aspect of his life.
meanings.sent5: The unitarian perspective brought a sense of peace to her heart.

meanings.definition: A member of a religious denomination that emphasizes unity and rejects the Trinity.
meanings.sent1: The unitarian community gathered for their weekly service.
meanings.sent2: She became a unitarian after exploring different faiths.
meanings.sent3: The unitarian potluck was a delicious display of unity.
meanings.sent4: In a world of division, the unitarian stood firm in their beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The unitarian's commitment to unity was inspiring to others.
